Legal_Issue: Whether Cynthia Wall meets the residency requirement for Canadian citizenship
Application_Facts: Cynthia Wall spent most of her time abroad as a missionary, with only 38 days of physical presence in Canada over four years; maintained significant ties to Canada including taxes, medical insurance, and family
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship application initially approved by Citizenship Judge
Remedy_Requested: Minister appealed the approval of citizenship application
Court_Ruling: Appeal allowed; case remanded for rehearing
Defendant_Behavior: Extended absence from Canada while maintaining Canadian ties
Grounds_for_Claim: Dispute over interpretation and application of residency requirements under the Citizenship Act
Legal_Standard: Three years of residence in Canada within the four years preceding application
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence, centralized mode of living, strength of ties to Canada
Procedural_Issue: Improper application of Koo guidelines by Citizenship Judge; failure to fully address residency requirement
Evidence_Used: Duration of physical presence in Canada, tax records, medical insurance, family ties
Legal_Provision_Cited: Citizenship Act residency requirement (3 out of 4 years)
Application_Basis: Koo’s combined approach to residency interpretation
Evidence_Assessed: 38 days of physical presence, ongoing financial and familial connections to Canada
Relief_Sought: Overturn of citizenship approval and rehearing
Governing_Rule: Residence interpreted as per Koo: combination of physical presence and centralized mode of living
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure by Citizenship Judge to adequately address residency requirement despite minimal physical presence
Outcome: Appeal allowed; decision set aside; matter referred back for rehearing
Harm_Assessment: Risk of granting citizenship without meeting法定 residency obligations
Cause_Description: Dispute over whether Cynthia Wall meets the residency requirement for Canadian citizenship
Evidence_Handling: Considered but not sufficiently weighed against statutory residency requirement
Evidence_Issues: Reliance on non-physical indicators of residence without sufficient justification under law
Residency_Compliance: Not met based on physical presence alone; questionable under holistic assessment
Evidence_Assessment: Ties to Canada acknowledged but insufficient to overcome lack of physical presence under proper legal interpretation
Decision_Rationale: Improper application of Koo framework; confusion between recommendations and legal findings
Evidentiary_Issues: Incomplete analysis of residency under binding legal standards
Legal_Standard_Applied: Interpretation of 'residence' under Pourghasemi, Papadogiorgakis, and Koo
